page.title: 13Education in Bakewell
page.content: There are four schools in Bakewell. Three of them are state schools and one is a private school. Children from {Over Haddon} all come to school in Bakewell. {Bakewell Church of England Infants {School}(Controlled) is in Bath Street in the centre of the town. It has 90 pupils aged from 4-7, and 4 teachers. {Bakewell Methodist Junior School}is also a Controlled school, and has about 160 pupils and seven teachers. It is a fairly new school having been built on the edge of the town in 1967. {Lady Manners Comprehensive School is also situated on the edge of the town. It has about 1200 pupils drawn from the neighbouring area and a staff of over 80. There is an annexe for a few boarding children. {St. Anselm's School,} is a small mixed preparatory boarding school.
